verses.roman:
śiṅgā vāṁśī bājāya keha, keha nāce gāya
sevaka yogāya tāmbūla, cāmara ḍhulāya

synonyms: śiṅgā vāṁśī—horns and flutes; bājāya—play; keha—some; keha—some of them; nāce—dance; gāya—sing; sevaka—a servant; yogāya—supplies; tāmbūla—betel nut; cāmara—fan; ḍhulāya—moves.
translation: Some of them played horns and flutes, and others danced and sang. Some of them offered betel nuts, and others waved cāmara fans about Him.
